other_tests.findings: Liver is diffusely high in signal intensity on T2 weighted images, suggestive of edema, possibly hepatitis. Gallbladder is abnormal with gallstones in the neck, edema of the wall, and incomplete distention. No common bile duct or intrahepatic duct dilatation. There is a 4mm cyst in the pancreatic head and a heterogeneously T1 hyperintense lesion in the lower pole of the left kidney, likely a hemorrhagic cyst.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Recommendation for follow-up in six months for the kidney lesion to ensure stability.
